properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 1 at 1:30PM MST until March 4 at 11:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM TO IMPACT THE SACRAMENTO MOUNTAINS...

An upper-level low will bring a prolonged period of lowland rains
and mountain snows to the Borderland. For the Sacramento
Mountains, precipitation is expected to start around sunrise
Tuesday and last until mid-day Wednesday. Snow levels will
fluctuate between 6500 and 8000 feet throughout the event with
totals of 6 to 12 inches possible above 8000 feet, including
Cloudcroft, with lower totals between 6500 and 8000.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12
inches possible with highest totals above 8000 feet.

* WHERE...Higher elevations of the Sacramento Mountains.

* WHEN...From early Tuesday morning through Wednesday morning.
properties.instruction:
impact travel creating slick and hazardous driving conditions,
possibly even making roads impassible.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM EARLY TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING
